source.title: Whale and dolphin migrations are being disrupted by climate change

facts: Marine mammals are being forced into new and more dangerous waters due to climate change.

Millennia-old migrations of some of the worldâ€™s largest filter-feeding whales, including humpbacks, fin whales, and blue whales, have been disrupted by changing environmental cues caused by global warming.
Climate change is altering migratory routes and reshaping critical habitats across the planet for various species.
Shorebirds are reaching their Arctic breeding grounds out of sync with insect blooms, which they rely on to feed their chicks.
Seagrass meadows that migrating sea turtles depend on as food sources have been disappearing due to warmer waters and cyclones.

neutral.headline: Climate Change Disrupts Marine Mammal Migratory Patterns
neutral.body_html: Marine mammals are being forced into new, more dangerous water routes due to climate change. This disruption affects the millennia-old migrations of some of Earth's largest filter-feeding whales and reshapes critical habitats across our planet.

conservative.headline: Global Warming Forces Whales to Alter Migration Routes
conservative.body_html: Due to global warming, marine mammals are being forced into new and more dangerous water routes. This disruption affects the millennia-old migrations of some of Earth's largest filter-feeding whales.

liberal.headline: Climate Change Threatens Marine Mammals and Their Habitats
liberal.body_html: Marine mammals are being forced into new, more dangerous water routes due to climate change. This disruption affects the millennia-old migrations of some of Earth's largest filter-feeding whales and reshapes critical habitats across our planet.
